newsitem.title: INDIA: Two killed in Kashmir as police fire on protesters.
newsitem.headline: Two killed in Kashmir as police fire on protesters.

text.p: Two women were fatally wounded on Saturday when Indian army soldiers opened fire on demonstrators protesting against the arrest of a separatist guerrilla in Kashmir, police said.

"More than hundred residents of Gadroo village were protesting against the arrest of a militant when army soldiers opened fire injuring two women. Both succumbed to their injuries later," a police official said.
Gadroo village is situated near Pulwama town, 30 km (20 miles) south of Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir.
More than a dozen militant groups are fighting for Kashmir's independence or merger with neighbouring Pakistan, which disputes the Himalayan region.

India, which controls two thirds of Kashmir, accuses Pakistan of training Kashmiri militants. Pakistan, which rules the remaining one third, denies the charge and says it only provides political and diplomatic support to the separatists.
Police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have been killed in militancy related violence during the last seven years.
